title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 380-4.3 - Disposal of specific wastes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 380-4.3 - Disposal of specific wastes

State Regulations
(a) The
following licensed material may be disposed of without regard to its
radioactivity, but must be disposed of in accordance with any other applicable
provisions of the ECL: (1)
0.05 microcurie
(1.85 kBq), or less, of hydrogen-3 or carbon-14 per gram of medium used for
liquid scintillation counting; (2)
0.05 microcurie (1.85 kBq), or less, of hydrogen-3 or carbon-14 per gram of
animal tissue, averaged over the weight of the entire animal; and
(3)
0.05 microcurie (1.85 kBq), or less, of
hydrogen-3 or carbon-14 per gram of biodegradable animal bedding. (b) Tissue disposed of under
subdivision (a) of this section must not be disposed of in a manner that would
permit its use either as food for humans or as animal feed. (c) Records must be maintained in accordance
with section
380-8.5
of this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
380-4.3

Amended

New

York State Register April 25, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 17, eff. 5/10/2018

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
